Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the amount of money being paid to out-of-state residential facilities.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or data to support the statement about the amount of money being paid.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that it is not cost-effective or necessary to send children to out-of-state residential facilities.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative reasons or justifications for sending children to out-of-state residential facilities that are not mentioned in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim may not provide a comprehensive or accurate representation of the situation with regards to out-of-state placements for children in state custody.
